turns.text: What kind of cars do you do you usually drive
turns.label: qw

turns.text: Right now we Ive got uh four year old Subaru and two year old Honda
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Oh my goodness Well were were were sort of sort of General Motors family I guess thats the way we were raised And uh uh we were overseas with I for number of years and when we came back we suddenly find out weve got five licensed drivers in the family
turns.label: ba

turns.text: Yeah and four cars and we bought some year old cars from National Car Rental
turns.label: b

turns.text: At least two of them We bought an Olds Calais and Buick Skylark Uh for you know - they each had twenty-one thousand miles or something like that
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Turns out thats pretty good place to buy cars because they maintain them and they can show you the records theyve gotten all their maintenance on schedule and everything like that Uh then weve got an eighty-six Chevy Spectrum that we bought new My daughter was freshman in college when we bought it for her
turns.label: sv

turns.text: And weve got eighty-four Toyota that we bought used So weve got four cars for our five licensed drivers Its like musical chairs
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And uh - but you know its interesting the two - even though my dad was Chevrolet man forever and ever and ever and we were in the retail milk business and he had all Chevrolet milk trucks and and we bought automobiles and all that it was almost like - and Chevrolet dealer was our friend and it was almost like the minute we got old and bought anything like but Chevrolet it would be like going and spitting on his grave But uh -

as we got older and got away and then we thought well you know you still could buy General Motors products and it was probably not that bad But uh we lived in Malaysia for I in nineteen uh eighty-one two three and four
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And and of course you dont buy General Motors products over there
turns.label: sd

turns.text: But we bought Volvo and I have never had car that Ive loved more I just cant afford them here Uh but I I just loved that car
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And uh we bought uh - we lived in the Philippines for I in eighty-five eighty-six and eighty-seven and we bought uh Ford Telstar which is somewhat similar to the Taurus Its sold in uh in uh the Far Eastern coun- uh Far East countries more than here
turns.label: sd

turns.text: But we really liked that And have you had experience with cars other than the ones you have
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Well yeah we had uh we had - these are the first cars that my husband and I have ever purchased ourselves
turns.label: ny

turns.text: The others were hand me downs through the families
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And uh we were real happy with them but all the ones that we ever had were the you know eight cylinder
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And all we had heard was was lot of negative press about the smaller cars and we both drive well forty-five miles round trip every day
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And so we wanted smaller car
turns.label: sd

turns.text: when we got ready to buy we needed smaller car to get better gas mileage and quite frankly we were afraid of the of the small cars
turns.label: sd

turns.text: You know as far as durability
turns.label: sd

turns.text: So we kind of - when we had our larger cars we didnt mind uh keeping them up
you know doing the maintenance and everything on them as long as we didnt have to do it very often
turns.label: sd

turns.text: But once they got over hundred thousand miles on them all of them you know it just kind of seemed to be the magic number for them
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Yeah yeah it seems that something goes every month
turns.label: b^r

turns.text: And Im afraid were going to be in that in another year with all of ours you know we got three eighty-sixes and an eighty-four
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And well probably be there with all of them You know its the same thing you know - I dont know whether uh you classify the Skylark and the Calais as - well I guess theyre intermediate
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Uh but uh we went on family trip to Massachusetts and there were five of us and five five of us never go anywhere together here Every- everybodys heading off in their own direction
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And I rented Buick Le Sabre
turns.label: sd

turns.text: and its the first big car I had since I had my nine passenger Impala station wagon from seventy-six to eighty And it made all the - I I had forgotten what driving big car was like
turns.label: sd

turns.text: It was just nice It floated
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Yeah What - we we sold or we we traded in our Le Sabre for our Subaru
turns.label: b

turns.text: It just - we ran the wheels right off of it

Yeah yeah yeah And uh you know Ive read - Im in the quality business at I Im quality manager and were were uh we deal we sell Im in the semiconductor group and we sell to uh Ford Chrysler and uh Delco
turns.label: b

turns.text: And there is amazing - I am just uh really impressed with the with the quality consciousness that the tho- these companies have put into their procurement and its I its come out as result of the competition from the Japanese
turns.label: sv

turns.text: And uh uh I - and you know we used to think Ford products were tinny I mean I was growing up - I was taught when I was growing up you know that that that real people bought General Motors products and peons bought

Ford products But just with the quality requirements that Ford is putting on us and the way they come into our plants - and theyre really uh uh stressing this partnerships in quality and you know and Chrysler are doing that but I really think Fords got leadersi- ship position in this right now And I think its showing up in their automobiles Their automobiles are getting very good quality reputation right now

And uh uh we went to uh Austin while back to basketball tournament and we were going to be meeting some of my wifes relatives down there so we decided rather than drive one of our cars down wed rent one
turns.label: sd

turns.text: and we went up to the local Budget and we were going to get Olds eighty-eight or something He said Ill tell you what for dollar day more Ill give you Lincoln Town Car
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And we drove that down and I hated to turn that back in
turns.label: sd

turns.text: We had that for three days And I absolutely loved - except I couldnt want to have to park it in tight places all the time
turns.label: sd

turns.text: I wouldnt want to have to pay for the gas either
turns.label: sv

turns.text: but I absolutely loved that automobile And you know it wasnt that Id - driving around down there we might have got sixteen to eighteen miles per gallon but on the trip down and back I filled up both coming and going so I knew what I actually got on the trip and it was about twenty-four miles gallon
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Uh and you know we just got it out on the highway and put it in cruise control at about sixty and let it let it float
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And it was pretty nice Are are are you planning on getting any additional or other cars
turns.label: sv

turns.text: No time soon Uh were our our we wont have any more licensed drivers for about thirteen years
turns.label: ng

turns.text: Yes So we uh so we dont plan on purchasing any more any time soon Both of our cars are getting
turns.label: ny

turns.text: oh around sixty thousand miles on them
Yeah You got another another thirty or forty thousand if you maintain them
turns.label: b

turns.text: Uh weve got - probably well get something in the next couple years My son will graduate from high school this year and and hes going to go to Richland College one year behind us
turns.label: sd

turns.text: its right - in fact uh our house is adjacent to the Richland property He wants to go to Texas Tech and hes probably going to have to go to Richland year to get some grades in order but uh the next year when he goes out to Tech he wants pickup and I want
turns.label: sd

turns.text: pickup I may get one and not let him have it But we have been looking at these red Chevro- - they theyre very popular around here

These uh uh red Chevy pickups and uh well probably do something like that uh uh incidentally - uh uh I dont know uh the uh the Credit Union has got deal now where you decide what you want and you call this number and uh they go negotiate the price for you And and or or send you to guy with whom theyve already got deal --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- and uh my boss just bought Chevy pickup and he got three thousand dollars off the sticker price doing it this way
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Yeah And uh uh you know you you figure out the options go around look at the dealers and get the best price you can and then go call this guy and and tell him what you want and hell put you in touch with certain guy certain person at that dealers place
turns.label: ny

turns.text: So Im going to try that the next time I buy one
turns.label: sd

turns.text: I think that would be good idea
turns.label: sv

turns.text: And and so you know I can go around and comparison shop and see if I can get better negotiation on my own But once one thing thats pain in the neck buying automobiles is negotiating
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Yeah Ive weve weve weve kind of been the types that will say this is what we intend to spend
turns.label: b

turns.text: this is the car we want will you sell me this car for that price
turns.label: ^q

turns.text: And and weve had - we with our - when we bought our Subaru the guy was like you cant do this to me and were were just like okay fine we we wont then
You know I mean hes like no no no

And uh and I I think thats probably the way youve got to do it When when I was young I went in and bought uh or made deal on sixty - this is nineteen sixty Id first come to Texas and made deal on sixty red Impala convertible --
turns.label: sv

turns.text: and this guy gave me this deal you know I told him how much I wanted to pay and for every fifty dollars hed have to go in and check with the boss and then Id have to sign something saying that if he could get this rate uh we would go ahead and buy Uh uh if he could get this rate I promised to buy and I left there on Saturday afternoon just totally exhausted I I was only twenty-five years old or something --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- I I left there and I I uh Id never done this before because Id always bought my previous cars from the guy my dad bought his milk trucks from and uh uh so I I got back and salesman that lived in the apartment had asked me uh uh if - hed heard I was going to get car and asked me what I paid for it He said well hey uh before you go buying anything - he says call this friend of mine at Wills Point There was guy that owned Chevrolet dealership up there
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And I called the guy and made an appointment to come up Monday morning and just driving fifty miles out of town it was difference and I mean it was difference of four hundred dollars but this was four hundred dollars on only twenty-five hundred
turns.label: sd

turns.text: is all we paid for cars in those days And uh uh so I called back the guy in Dallas and I told him that Id left him check for tax title and license and everything and I said I want to cancel my order and and dont try to cash the check because Im going to Ive stopped payment on it already and he says oh somebodys taking he said what did you get deal for Bill And I told him he says somebodys taking you for ride And I said no somebody took me for ride last Saturday
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And uh uh and I I find that uh - and for the longest time then I drove up to Wills Point and and the and the fellow died since then and and some of his relatives have taken over the business and that - but - and since then I had
